intro: Ypsilandra parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ypsilandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ypsilandra parviflora is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
